title: INTERSPEECH_2014_40_abs

sentences.text: This paper deals with the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis .
We have previously introduced a statistical model describing the generating process of speech F0 contours , based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model .

One remarkable feature of this model is that it has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating the Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours .
To associate a sequence of the Fujisaki-model parameters with a text input based on statistical learning , this paper proposes extending this model to a context-dependent one .
We further propose a parameter training algorithm for the present model based on a decision tree-based context clustering .

summary: This paper deals with the problem of generating the fundamental frequency -LRB- F0 -RRB- contour of speech from a text input for text-to-speech synthesis . We have previously introduced a statistical model describing the generating process of speech F0 contours , based on the discrete-time version of the Fujisaki model . One remarkable feature of this model is that it has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating the Fujisaki-model parameters from raw F0 contours . To associate a sequence of the Fujisaki-model parameters with a text input based on statistical learning , this paper proposes extending this model to a context-dependent one . We further propose a parameter training algorithm for the present model based on a decision tree-based context clustering .

Predicate-deals_with.label: deals with
Predicate-deals_with.description: The predicate 'deals with' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. paper) addresses or handles the object (e.g. problem), often in a manner that involves understanding, resolving, or providing insight into it.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To describe means to convey or express information about something in a concise and meaningful way. It involves providing an account, explanation, or representation that captures the essential characteristics of its subject matter. In this sense, describing connects the subject (the entity being described) with the object (the description itself), forming a relationship where the subject is understood through the object's portrayal.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' indicates a relationship where the subject's existence or validity relies on or is grounded in the information provided by the object. It suggests that the subject's characteristics, properties, or principles are derived from or inspired by the object.

Predicate-describing.label: describing
Predicate-describing.description: The predicate 'describing' indicates that the subject (a linguistic or computational entity) provides an account, explanation, or representation of the object (typically a phenomenon, process, or concept). In general, it suggests that the subject offers a descriptive framework for understanding the nature and characteristics of the object.

Predicate-has_allowed_us_to_derive_an_ef.label: has allowed us to derive an efficient algorithm based on powerful statistical methods for estimating
Predicate-has_allowed_us_to_derive_an_ef.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (typically a method or model) has enabled the development of an efficient algorithm by leveraging powerful statistical methods for estimating. The connection between the subject and object lies in the idea that the subject's properties, characteristics, or capabilities have facilitated the creation of this algorithm.

Predicate-proposes_extending_to.label: proposes extending to
Predicate-proposes_extending_to.description: The predicate 'proposes extending to' indicates that the subject (in this case, an entity such as a paper or proposal) suggests or recommends expanding or applying its scope, principles, or ideas to reach or encompass something specified by the object. The connection between the subject and object is one of potential application or extension.

Predicate-associate_with.label: associate with
Predicate-associate_with.description: To associate with means to connect or link two entities (subject and object) by establishing a relationship between them. This predicate implies that the subject has some kind of affinity, correspondence, or similarity with the object, often based on shared characteristics, properties, or principles.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, alternative, or approach. The subject of the predicate 'proposes' presents an idea, plan, or concept that it considers viable and worthy of consideration by others.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It represents an is-a relationship, where the subject is more specialized than the object.
